segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman is while the sink is overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she’s acting like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t she feel the water on her foot?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are about to cause a whole other mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That boy is going to fall off that stool if he’s not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl is just encouraging him, standing there with her hand out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know what’s worse—the water everywhere or the kids stealing cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole kitchen is a mess, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
